title: 4,300-Mile 2016 McLaren 675LT Coupe
description: This 2016 McLaren 675LT is one of 500 coupe examples produced and spent time in Ontario prior to being imported to the US in 2024. Having 4,300 miles, it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.8-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch transaxle and is finished in Silica White over Carbon Black and Almond White upholstery. Equipment includes the Carbon-Fiber Exterior Upgrade Package, a titanium exhaust system, a front-axle lift system, 19" and 20" 10-spoke forged alloy wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, a carbon-fiber roof scoop, an active rear spoiler, soft-close dihedral doors, carbon-shelled seats, the Track Telemetry Camera System, a rearview camera, parking sensors, a Meridian sound system, launch control, dual-zone automatic climate control, and a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation. This 675LT was acquired by the selling dealer in 2025 and is now offered in New York with a Carfax report and a clean South Carolina title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 4,300-Mile 2016 McLaren 675LT Coupe at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #188,628.
text: This 2016 McLaren 675LT is one of 500 coupe examples produced and spent time in Ontario prior to being imported to the US in 2024. Having 4,300 miles, it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.8-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch transaxle and is finished in Silica White over Carbon Black and Almond White upholstery. Equipment includes the Carbon-Fiber Exterior Upgrade Package, a titanium exhaust system, a front-axle lift system, 19″ and 20″ 10-spoke forged alloy wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, a carbon-fiber roof scoop, an active rear spoiler, soft-close dihedral doors, carbon-shelled seats, the Track Telemetry Camera System, a rearview camera, parking sensors, a Meridian sound system, launch control, dual-zone automatic climate control, and a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation. This 675LT was acquired by the selling dealer in 2025 and is now offered in New York with a Carfax report and a clean South Carolina title. The 675LT utilizes a carbon-fiber MonoCell with a rear extruded aluminum subframe and is equipped with thinner glass, a revised front splitter, and a larger active rear Airbrake that serve to increase the length of the car by 1.5″ when compared to the 650S. The Longtail bodywork is finished in Silica White and features a carbon-fiber front lip spoiler with end plates, side skirts, side air intakes, roof scoop, and a rear diffuser as well as a vented polycarbonate engine cover, soft-close dihedral doors, front and rear parking sensors, LED headlights and taillights, and dual exhaust outlets. Damage to the right-front corner is listed in an October 2017 entry of the Carfax report. The 19″ and 20″ 10-spoke forged alloy wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires showing 2015 date codes. The suspension features a ProActive Chassis Control system with three selectable modes, and stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes with orange McLaren-branded calipers fitted over six- and four-piston carbon-ceramic rotors. The car is equipped with a front-axle lift system. The carbon-shelled seats are trimmed in Almond White leather and Carbon Black Alcantara with orange seatbelts, and amenities include a rearview camera, a Meridian sound system, launch control, dual-zone automatic climate control, McLaren-branded carbon-fiber door sills, 675LT-branded floor mats, carbon-fiber trim, and a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation and Bluetooth connectivity. A plaque affixed to the left door sill identifies this 675LT as one of 500 examples produced. The flat-bottom Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features carbon-fiber trim and shift paddles, and it frames a central 9k-rpm tachometer with an inset digital speedometer that is flanked by two digital displays. The car features a McLaren Track Telemetry system with a lap timer and three cameras. The digital odometer indicates 4,300 miles. The twin-turbocharged 3.8-liter V8 features dry-sump lubrication and was factory rated at 666 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque, an increase of approximately 25 horsepower and 16 lb-ft of torque over the standard 650S. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch Seamless Shift Gearbox (SSG) with twin clutches and three variable shift profiles. The car features a titanium exhaust system as well as an open differential with brake steering. The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage. You are not connected to real-time updates. html:
This 2016 McLaren 675LT is one of 500 coupe examples produced and spent time in Ontario prior to being imported to the US in 2024. Having 4,300 miles, it is powered by a twin-turbocharged 3.8-liter V8 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch transaxle and is finished in Silica White over Carbon Black and Almond White upholstery. Equipment includes the Carbon-Fiber Exterior Upgrade Package, a titanium exhaust system, a front-axle lift system, 19″ and 20″ 10-spoke forged alloy wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, a carbon-fiber roof scoop, an active rear spoiler, soft-close dihedral doors, carbon-shelled seats, the Track Telemetry Camera System, a rearview camera, parking sensors, a Meridian sound system, launch control, dual-zone automatic climate control, and a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation. This 675LT was acquired by the selling dealer in 2025 and is now offered in New York with a Carfax report and a clean South Carolina title.

The 675LT utilizes a carbon-fiber MonoCell with a rear extruded aluminum subframe and is equipped with thinner glass, a revised front splitter, and a larger active rear Airbrake that serve to increase the length of the car by 1.5″ when compared to the 650S. The Longtail bodywork is finished in Silica White and features a carbon-fiber front lip spoiler with end plates, side skirts, side air intakes, roof scoop, and a rear diffuser as well as a vented polycarbonate engine cover, soft-close dihedral doors, front and rear parking sensors, LED headlights and taillights, and dual exhaust outlets. Damage to the right-front corner is listed in an October 2017 entry of the Carfax report.

The 19″ and 20″ 10-spoke forged alloy wheels are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires showing 2015 date codes. The suspension features a ProActive Chassis Control system with three selectable modes, and stopping power is provided by four-wheel disc brakes with orange McLaren-branded calipers fitted over six- and four-piston carbon-ceramic rotors. The car is equipped with a front-axle lift system.

The carbon-shelled seats are trimmed in Almond White leather and Carbon Black Alcantara with orange seatbelts, and amenities include a rearview camera, a Meridian sound system, launch control, dual-zone automatic climate control, McLaren-branded carbon-fiber door sills, 675LT-branded floor mats, carbon-fiber trim, and a touchscreen infotainment system with navigation and Bluetooth connectivity.

A plaque affixed to the left door sill identifies this 675LT as one of 500 examples produced.

The flat-bottom Alcantara-wrapped steering wheel features carbon-fiber trim and shift paddles, and it frames a central 9k-rpm tachometer with an inset digital speedometer that is flanked by two digital displays. The car features a McLaren Track Telemetry system with a lap timer and three cameras. The digital odometer indicates 4,300 miles.

The twin-turbocharged 3.8-liter V8 features dry-sump lubrication and was factory rated at 666 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque, an increase of approximately 25 horsepower and 16 lb-ft of torque over the standard 650S.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch Seamless Shift Gearbox (SSG) with twin clutches and three variable shift profiles. The car features a titanium exhaust system as well as an open differential with brake steering.

The Carfax report shows the aforementioned damage.
